abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column asserts FIFA should suspend president Sepp Blatter, target of criminal investigation, just as it did to his top deputy Jerome Valcke, when he was accused of being involved in black-market ticketing scheme, and just as it did to 11 other people after their arrests on corruption charges.
lead_paragraph: FIFA president Sepp Blatter has hinted he might try to extend his reign, even as a corruption scandal engulfs the organization, which apparently lacks an internal candidate free of controversy to replace him.

headline.main: FIFA’s Captain Clings to the Helm of His Sinking Ship
headline.print_headline: FIFA’s Captain Clings to the Helm of His Sinking Ship

snippet: FIFA president Sepp Blatter has hinted he might try to extend his reign, even as a corruption scandal engulfs the organization, which apparently lacks an internal candidate free of controversy to replace him.
